controller

Class ImageController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.ImageController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Features, IImageController

    public class ImageController
extends java.lang.Object
implements IImageController, Features
    A class representing the image processing controller. Supports two usage modes - a command line-operated script reading mode (see IImageController Interface) and an interactive GUI mode (see Features Interface). The script mode supports parsing a properly formatted .txt file that has different commands on each line, or any other Readable input with newline-separated commands, such as a String or standard input. The GUI mode uses an event-driven model - the view will call features from the Features Interface as the user interacts with it, and the controller handles the response accordingly.

    • Method Detail

      • commandReader

        public void commandReader(java.lang.Readable input)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Starts up the controller by taking a readable object that specifies a series of image processing commands, to be run as a script. The input can be a string, a file, standard input, or any other class of input that implements the Readable interface. Individual commands must be on separate lines. This method will only parse the first argument on each line and pass the rest of the arguments to the appropriate method. If the first argument on a line cannot be matched, throws an exception. See README for valid commands.
        Specified by:
        commandReader in interface IImageController
        Parameters:
        input - the image processing script to be implemented
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If a command is invalid, if the model determines that the command's arguments are invalid, or if the provided Readable is null.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If such an exception is thrown by the model.

      • exitProgram

        public void exitProgram()
        Exits the program.
        Specified by:
        exitProgram in interface Features

      • filter

        public void filter(Filter filter,
                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> args)
        Asks the model to perform the image filtering operation specified by the filter input, using the provided arguments as applicable (not all filtering operations require arguments, see documentation for the model), then updates the view with the result. If the model throws an exception, the view will be instructed to display an error message.
        Specified by:
        filter in interface Features
        Parameters:
        filter - a filter enum specifying the operation to be performed
        args - a list of arguments which may be referenced by the corresponding filter method.

      • executeScript

        public void executeScript(java.lang.String script)
        Takes a script provided by the view and then uses the script mode functionality to evaluate it. Unlike normal script mode, the view will be updated after resolution. Any exception thrown during script execution will be passed to the view as an error display message.
        Specified by:
        executeScript in interface Features
        Parameters:
        script - a command script - see controller's commandReader documentation.

      • generateCheckerboard

        public void generateCheckerboard()
        Asks the view to request square size input from the user, then asks the model to generate a checkerboard of the specified size, to be passed to the view for display. If the model throws an exception, it will be passed to the view as an error display message.
        Specified by:
        generateCheckerboard in interface Features

      • generateRainbow

        public void generateRainbow()
        Asks the view to request rainbow size and orientation input from the user, then asks the model to generate a rainbow image, to be passed to the view for display. If the model throws an exception, it will be passed to the view as an error display message.
        Specified by:
        generateRainbow in interface Features

      • openFileFromGUI

        public void openFileFromGUI()
        Asks the view to let user choose a file to open. Will only allow users to open file types that are supported by ImageIO class (and thus the image utilities used by this program). Adds the selected file to the program's model and view. Any errors that occur will be passed to the view as an error display message.
        Specified by:
        openFileFromGUI in interface Features

      • saveFileFromGUI

        public void saveFileFromGUI()
        Saves the loaded image. User specifies the filename and path using the GUI. New directories can be created in the window using the "New Folder" button. Any errors that occur will be passed to the view as an error display message.
        Specified by:
        saveFileFromGUI in interface Features
